incidents.name: Users are unable to login to SendGrid UI. Error "Failed to Fetch"

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the login issue has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring, while users will be able to login to the SendGrid account. We will provide another update in hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers identified the issue and are working towards a fix. We will provide another update very soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers identified the issue at 21:30 Pacific Time (PT) and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update very soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating an issue affecting the ability of some users to log into their SendGrid accounts. Impacted users may encounter a "Failed to Fetch" error message when attempting to log in.

Please note that this issue does not affect email sending, and your outgoing mail will continue to function as expected. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve this problem.

We will provide an update within the next hour or sooner if more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Click Tracking Events Delayed and Minor Impact on Single Sends

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with click tracking and Single Sends has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Due to incident with third-party vendors, between 1:40 AM Pacific Time and 2:50 AM Pacific Time on 29th Aug 2024, our engineers began investigating an issue with click tracking and Single Sends. Users may experience delays with click tracking events being updated and issues with Single Sends. This does/does not impact mail send. 

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Customers received incorrect usage alert emails

incident_updates.body: On 8/28/24, some customers were sent emails that incorrect stated usage was over the daily limit and in some cases over 100% of the daily limit. We identified the cause of the issue and have corrected it so future usage alerts will be correct. No emails were sent in error from impacted accounts, and emails can still be sent as long as the account is under its daily/ monthly limit.

incidents.name: Missing Category Stats between July 25th and July 30th

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the missing category statistics have been properly and accurately restored. All statistics are now displaying normally at this time.

Our engineers confirmed that the deployed fix to restore any missing category stats between the dates of July 25th and July 30th is complete. We will monitor the results of this deploy over the next 30 minutes to ensure proper restoration of missing category statistics for the period at which point another update will be given.

Our engineers have identified the work needed to restore missing category stats between the dates of July 25th and July 30th. The work needed to complete restoration during this period is anticipated to require several hours for the internal SendGrid system to properly backfill the missing statistics.  Once the data is fully and accurately backfilled for the period, another update will be provided via this status post. Thank you for your patience.

Our engineers are continuing to work towards a fix for missing category stats from the dates of July 25th to July 30th. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers are continuing to work towards a fix for missing category stats from the dates of July 25th to July 30th. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 10:12 AM Pacific Time on August 20th, our engineers began investigating an issue with category stats. Users may have experienced missing category stats data via API and UI from the dates of July 25th to July 30th. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SendGrid Platform Unavailability

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored system performance and confirmed the issue with Mail Send and Statistics between the period of 7:40 AM PDT and 8:54 AM PDT has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineering teams are continuing to monitor system performance. We will provide an update in 3 hours, or as soon as more information is available.
Our engineering teams are continuing to monitor system performance. We will provide an update in 2 hours, or as soon as more information is available.

At 1:01 PM PDT, our engineering team confirmed that all delayed events between the period of 7:40 AM PDT and 8:54 AM PDT for mail send and statistics were fully dequeued and processed successfully. Another update will be provided in the next 30 minutes in order to confirm full recovery and stability of the SendGrid platform.

At this time, our engineers have confirmed to have mitigated the majority of impact for degraded components. The impact time window is confirmed to have started at approximately 7:40 AM PDT. At 8:08 AM PDT, our engineering team deployed a change to mitigate degraded components. At 8:54 AM PDT, our team confirmed that this same deploy was fully in effect and allowed any new mail send and statistics to process properly from that time. However, mail send and statistics requests that were requested, scheduled or deferred between the times of 7:40 AM PDT and 8:54 AM PDT may still be impacted with delays until further notice. New mail send requests, Marketing Campaigns usage, SendGrid API and UI usage, statistics retrieval and email activity usage after 8:54 AM PDT is confirmed to be working as expected and fully functional. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as possible.

Our engineers have identified the problems related to platform unavailability and problems will continue to be explored for resolution. Currently, users of the SendGrid system may experience delays in requested mail send, errors when using Marketing Campaigns, errors when using the SendGrid API and user interface, as well as delays in retrieval of statistics. This incident does impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as possible.

Our engineers are still investigating various issues reported and known to be impacting the SendGrid platform. At this time, users of the SendGrid system may continue to experience issues using both the API and web console interface. We will continue to investigate and provide further details as they become known. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as possible.

Starting around 7:45 AM PDT on August 15th, our engineers began investigating issues with the SendGrid platform. As of now, users will experience issues logging into the platform and accessing the user interface. Other errors may be present. We are continuing to investigate the full scope of the issue and will update impact. We will provide another update in 60 minutes or as soon as more updates become available.

incidents.name: Legacy Marketing Campaigns Maintenance: Saturday, August 10, 4pm to 5pm Pacific Time (PT)

incident_updates.body: The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

In order to increase the stability and scalability of our systems, we are performing maintenance on Legacy Marketing Campaigns on August 10, from 4pm to 5pm Pacific Time (PT). During this time, customers may experience errors while creating and editing campaigns and contacts. This Maintenance only impacts users using Legacy Marketing Campaigns.

incidents.name: Subuser Management IP Assignment User Interface Errors

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed that the aforementioned subuser management problems have been resolved. This incident did not impact mail send. All services are now operating normally at this time.
At 11:31 AM PDT, our engineers deployed a change as a means to resolve the issue. The deployed change will be monitored over the next 30 minutes at which point another update will be provided.

Around 10:40 AM PDT, our engineers identified the root cause of the errors and are working towards deploying a fix. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting at 10:05 AM PDT, our engineers began investigating an issue in which assigning of IP addresses for outbound mail send to sub users within "Settings > Subuser Management" within the user interface results in errors.  Errors may include a red banner message stating "not found in the request body".  Additionally, intermittent errors may include inaccurate assignment of IP addresses when clicking "change sending" and selecting IP addresses for a designated sub user to utilize. This does not directly impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Teammate Management and Sign-In Resulting in Errors

incident_updates.body:
Our engineers have monitored the stability of the deployment to the SendGrid platform and have confirmed that no new teammate errors are present. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Teammates who have not linked to Twilio through the Unified Login feature would not be impacted. If you have linked a teammate, do not make changes to the teammate's profile or permissions as they will be unable to properly login to SendGrid. You can resolve this for impacted teammates by deleting and recreating the impacted teammate using the same email address. 

Please reach out to our Support Team for any further questions or issues not resolved by deleting and recreating.

At 3:04 PM PDT, our engineering team deployed a fix to mitigate more unexpected errors related to signing in with teammates, adjusting teammate settings and navigating the web console while being logged in as a teammate. Only a subset of users and their teammates were impacted with the aforementioned errors. This incident did not impact mail send. The deployed fix and its results will be monitored for the next 30 minutes for stability.

Our engineering team is continuing to work towards a fix. At this time, users may continue to experience errors when signing in with teammate credentials, making edits to the settings for some teammates or navigating the SendGrid console with some teammates. These problems will only impact a subset of users who are utilizing teammates. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Having identified the issue, our engineering team are continuing to work towards a fix. As of now, users may continue to experience errors when signing in with teammate credentials or making edits to settings for existing teammates. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. At this time users may continue to experience errors when signing in with teammate credentials or making edits to settings for existing teammates. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 11:40 AM PDT on August 1st, our engineers began investigating an issue with teammate management and teammate sign in. Users may experience errors when signing in with teammate credentials or making edits to settings for existing teammates. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SendGrid Plan Changes Unavailable and Payment Errors

incident_updates.body: The billing functionality has been confirmed as properly restored to the SendGrid platform. Restoration of the SendGrid billing functionality took place at approximately 1:30 PM PDT. All services are now operating normally at this time.

In reviewing the stability of the SendGrid platform billing functionality, our team determined that the billing system is showing signs of significant improvement. However, the stability of the system will continue to be monitored until this issue is confirmed to be resolved. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

As of 1:27 PM PDT, the third party involved in this incident has notified that a deployment has been made and it was stated that there is a noted recovery in performance to the billing functionality of downstream impacted systems (Twilio SendGrid). While this recovery should include the SendGrid platform and its billing function, we will continue to investigate the functionality of the SendGrid platform specifically as it relates to provider changes. Until this issue is confirmed as resolved, please be aware that there may still be degraded and intermittent inabilities to change plans (upgrade or downgrade), process a payment or make other billing-related changes within the SendGrid user interface. This incident does not directly impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Due to a third party provider incident, the SendGrid platform is experiencing an issue in billing functionality as of 12:03 PM PDT. Users may experience inability to upgrade or downgrade plans, and cannot access the billing page via the user interface. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Errors returned at SendGrid login page at attempted sign in

incident_updates.body:
Starting from 05.50AM PT 06/29/2024 to 09:22 AM PT 06/29/2024, we experienced an issue with the Twilio SendGrid login page. 
Users had received errors when attempting to sign in at the login page and also experienced issues accessing certain v3 endpoints resulting in 500 errors. This had a minor impact on creation of mail send batch IDs. 
This issue has been mitigated and resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: DKIM Signature System Misconfiguration

incident_updates.body: Starting at approximately 9:30 AM PT on June 27th, our engineers determined that a subset of SendGrid accounts began to sign processed email messages with incorrect DKIM signatures due to a system misconfiguration. This misconfiguration of DKIM signing may have resulted in failed DMARC when being assessed by recipient servers. At approximately 3:50 PM PT the same day, the platform restored stability to the signing of DKIM signatures for the small subset of impacted accounts. Although new email messages processed after 3:50 PM PT for these same affected accounts will have proper DKIM signing, messages requested for processing during the impact period that have yet to be assessed by recipient servers will be judged based on their misconfigured DKIM signature.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved issues with intermittent unavailability of Sendgrid's suppression email server. From 12:00 AM PST to 1:38 PM PST June 13th some customers may have seen delays in suppressions logging in stats, webhooks, email activity, and bounce forwarding. There was no data lost and the issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Retroincident - Domain Authentication Endpoint failures

incident_updates.body:
Starting around 8pm PST on June 11th, we started seeing an elevated number of 500 errors affecting sender authentication endpoints (such as validating domains and records), but these were not related to mail sending API requests.

Changes are being reverted and no further issues should be seen from now on and moving forward.

incidents.name: Engagement Event Reporting Delay.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with engagement event tracking has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix for all delayed engagement events and they have been now delivered and the system is up to date, we are still monitoring system performance. We will provide another update as soon as more information becomes available.

On June 4, 2024, at 8:39 AM PT, our engineering team began an investigation into an issue affecting engagement event tracking. We are seeing a delay of up to 30 minutes in reporting engagement events such as opens, clicks, unsubscribes, etc. No data is lost, and the data is being reported correctly, just with a slight delay. The team is working on a fix and this does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Marketing Contact Lists not updating count.

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with contact counts and has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

One June 3, 2024 at 9:02 AM PT, our engineering team began an investigation into an issue affecting the contact count on Marketing Contact Lists.  The count in the UI may not reflect these changes immediately. However the actual process of adding or deleting contacts is functioning correctly. This does/does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Increase Click, Opens and Unsubscribe

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved the issues with increase in click/unsubscribe/open caused by bots on recipient servers. From May 15, 2024 to July 3, 2024 customers may observed an increase in click/unsubscribe/open events. Our team has rolled back unsubscribe events triggered by these recipient servers and the issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Errors when Creating Teammates

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix to Teammates and confirmed the issue has been resolved for future Teammate creation and invitations. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix for Teammates and Teammate invitations affected by this incident issue and we are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.
Although our engineers have identified the problem, a fix is still being explored at this time.  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified why new Teammate invitations are being sent but do not allow creation of new Teammates linked to those same triggered invitations. Our team is continuing to work toward a fix to allow for proper creation of teammates and to avoid this issue from occurring. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 11:55 AM PT, our engineers began investigating an issue with Twilio SendGrid Teammate creation. Some users will experience errors in the SendGrid web user interface when creating new teammates and be unable to do so. This issue does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified the primary cause, taken remediating action and are beginning to see recovery from this incident. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 12:20 AM UTC on 18th April 2024, our engineers have began investigating an issue with test feature in Legacy Campaigns. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

The contacts page also does not load and users can experience errors. This does impact the Contacts List API. This does not impact API mail send.  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Email Delays on April 8th, 2024

incident_updates.body: Starting 5:00PM PST on Monday, April 8th, a small subset of customers saw a delay in email delivery that lasted up to 18 hours, all emails were sent successfully. Any users who saw any abnormal delay on their delivery could potentially have been affected due to this incident. There were a total of 26,300 emails affected by this incident. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Trouble Editing Scopes On New Teammates Between April 4th and April 5th, 2024

incident_updates.body: Starting 2:00PM PST on Thursday, April 4th, customers who created teammates may see errors when trying to edit those teammate scopes. Our engineers have investigated and fixed this issue for newly created teammates as of 4:30PM PST April 5th. Customers who created a teammate between Thursday and Friday are advised have to delete and recreate a new teammate to be able to edit the scopes. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Contact Count is Not Updated after Contacts are Uploaded on New Marketing Campaigns(TNE)

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed that Marketing Campaigns Contact count values are now reflecting as expected. Customers should see the correct contact count values reflected within their accounts, and all services are operating as epected.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Customers should see contact counts begin reflecting as expected. We'll continue to monitor and provide an update within the next hour.

Our engineers are continuing to work towards a fix for this issue. At this time, customers may still see erroneous contact counts reflected. We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue causing contact uploads to not reflect in contact counts. We are working towards a fix and will provide another update within an hour or sooner if more information becomes available.

Our engineering team is still investigating the system performance of contact credit count for New Marketing Campaigns. Mail Send is not affected, and credits are being uploaded correctly. We will keep investigating and provide a new update as soon as it is available.

Starting around 15:30 hrs PDT on March 31st, our engineers began investigating an issue with contact counts not being updated with recently updated lists on new marketing campaigns(TNE). This issue is noticeable once the contacts are successfully uploaded onto a list via New Marketing campaigns. 
The contacts will be available to customers for use however customers may notice a delay of the count being updated as a workaround to update the contact count is being currently implemented. 
Mail Send is not impacted. 
We will provide another update in an hour, or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Two-Factor Authentication SMS login codes

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with two-factor authentication SMS delays has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Overall, our system has reached a normal steady state. We are continuing to monitor remaining queued messages, but as of now most messages are sending without any additional queuing delay.

We have identified the primary cause, taken remediating action and are beginning to see recovery from this incident with queued messages beginning to be sent. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting on March 26th at 5:35 AM, Pacific Time (PT). SendGrid is currently experiencing an issue with the sendgrid.com website. Customer may be unable to load the site or login to their accounts. Currently, all SMS 2FA codes are being queued preventing users from logging in with SMS 2FA. We are working on the issue, and we will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Email API and Marketing Campaigns Delivery Delays

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved issues with Mail Send Delays in the EU, for both Email API and Email Marketing Campaigns. From 9:30 AM to 10:00 AM PST customers may have experienced a delay when sending email. This delay only affected some mail senders in the region during the period. The issue has been resolved, and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Email Activity Exports Not Being Received

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Email Activity Feed Export has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers are still investigating this issue. Email activity export emails might not be received by some customers. Users who are triggering an activity feed export from their SendGrid Account may not receive the subsequent email containing the export. Searching in the activity feed still functions as expected as well as the API endpoints for users with the Email Activity add-on.  We will provide the next updates in 1 hour or sooner as they become available.

Starting around 01:00 AM PT on March 18, 2024, our engineers began investigating an issue with email activity export emails might not be received by some customers. Users who are triggering an activity feed export from their SendGrid Account may not receive the subsequent email containing the export. Searching in the activity feed still functions as expected as well as the API endpoints for users with the Email Activity add-on. This does not impact mail send.  We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Latencies and timeouts with Whitelabel API

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with the Whitelabel API and Domain Authentication UI has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Users should no longer be noting latency or 500 level errors when using the Whitelabel API or authenticating their domain within the UI. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 12:40PM PST on March 15th, our engineers began investigating an issue with the Whitelabel API. Users may experience latency and 500 level errors when using this API endpoint. Users may also note similar issues when authenticating a domain within the UI. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: 404 errors when calling API endpoint /v3/user/webhooks/event/settings/.

incident_updates.body: From around 10:35am PDT to 12:22pm PDT on March 11, 2024, customers experienced 404 errors when calling the API endpoint that returns the oldest webhook ("/v3/user/webhooks/event/settings/"). It didn't affect mail send, webhook posting or webhook settings. This issue has been mitigated and resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

However, users may still had some mail delays within the timeframe specified.
